content.question: Data were collected on the number of days per week that members visit a certain fitness center. The values varied from 0 to 7, and a distribution of relative frequencies for the values was created. Let the random variable <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the number of days per week that a member visits. The mean of <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></math> is 3.12. Which of the following statements is the best interpretation of the mean?

choices.label: Each member visits the fitness center 3 or 4 days per week.
The average number of days that each member visits the fitness center is 3.12 days per week.
Half the members visit the fitness center 3 days per week or less, and the other half visit 4 days per week or more.
The long-run average resulting from repeated sampling of members of the fitness center will approach 3.12 days per week.
For a random sample of members selected from the population, the average number of visits for the sample will be 3.12 days per week.

content.answer: The long-run average resulting from repeated sampling of members of the fitness center will approach 3.12 days per week.
